articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Nam Sun Hui
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Nam Sun Hui
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Tuesday sent a wreath to the bier of Nam Sun Hui, expressing deep condolences over her death.
					 Prof. Nam was rector of Pyongyang Teacher Training College.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Ambassador 
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a talk with Le Van Cu, outgoing Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Saint Lucia
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Saint Lucia
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Stephenson King, Prime Minister of Saint Lucia, Tuesday on the 32nd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Brunei Darussalam
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Brunei Darussalam
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Monday sent a message of greetings to Mohamed Bolkiah, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei Darussalam, on its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would grow stronger in various fields through cooperation between the two foreign ministries.

articles.title: Chinese Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Chinese Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, and his party visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					 The visitors made deep bows in humble reverence for the President who made undying feats for the development of the DPRK-China friendship and global independence.
					
					 Zhang Zhijun wrote in the visitor's book that Kim Il Sung would be always alive in the hearts of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Reception Given to Mark Russia's Defenders of Motherland Day
articles.content:
Reception Given to Mark Russia's Defenders of Motherland Day
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Valery Sukhinin and Military Attache Aleksei Bartusov of the Russian embassy here hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Tuesday to mark the Day of Defenders of the Motherland.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, generals and other officers of the Korean People's Army and officials concerned and representatives and military attaches of embassies of different countries here.
					
					 Russian embassy officials were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Awarded Order of Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Awarded Order of Russia
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The Russian Federation of International Charity Organizations "World of Goodwill" decided on Feb. 11 to confer Order "Heart of Passion" on General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 A ceremony of conveying the order took place at the DPRK embassy in Moscow on Feb. 16.
					
					 Present there were President Oleg Oleinik and officials of the Federation and Ambassador Kim Yong Jae and staff members of the DPRK embassy.
					
					 The order and its certificate were handed over to the ambassador at the ceremony.

articles.title: Gift from CCTV
articles.content:
Gift from CCTV 
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Chinese Central TV.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Huang Chuanfang, deputy editor-in-chief of the CCTV, on a visit to the DPRK, Monday.

articles.title: Project for Nampho-Pyongyang Seawater Pipeline Started
articles.content:
Project for Nampho-Pyongyang Seawater Pipeline Started
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- A pipeline for conveying seawater is to be laid between Nampho and Pyongyang of the DPRK. 
					 This pipeline will help supply enough quality drinking water to the citizens of the capital city.
					
					 A ground-breaking ceremony for the project took place on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, builders and working people in the city of Pyongyang.

articles.title: Solar Greenhouses for Vegetable Production Built
articles.content:
Solar Greenhouses for Vegetable Production Built
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Thirty-six solar greenhouses for cultivation of vegetable have been built in Hamhung City in northeastern part of the DPRK.
					 These greenhouses are of great economic profitability as they need no fuel and produce vegetables even in cold winter.
					
					 The completion of their construction helps put the vegetable farming on a more scientific and intensive basis and enrich the diet of citizens.
					
					 The city also successfully carried out the preparations for vegetable production in these greenhouses. It settled lots of technical problems arising in winter vegetable production in greenhouses, thus laying a solid foundation for supply of vegetables to the citizens in every season.
					
					 Fresh vegetables produced in those greenhouses are now being supplied to the citizens, delighting them.

articles.title: Production Base for Preserved Vegetables
articles.content:
Production Base for Preserved Vegetables
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The Sariwon Jongbang Foodstuff Producers' Cooperative in North Hwanghae Province of the DPRK is famous for production of vegetables preserved in soy sauce, traditional food of the Koreans.
					 The cooperative with a history of 50 odd years has a streamline production system and turns out various kinds of preserved vegetables including radish, cucumber, garlic and hot pepper.
					
					 Its reliable base for raw materials supplies sesame, perilla and other crops needed for preserving in soy sauce as well as vegetables.
					
					 Its packed products are popular among inhabitants and travelers as they are tasty and easy to keep.
					
					 The cooperative is doing its management under a meticulous plan to produce much more nutritious side dishes with good taste.

articles.title: Haeju Boiled Rice with Assorted Mixtures, Typical of Korean Food
articles.content:
Haeju Boiled Rice with Assorted Mixtures, Typical of Korean Food
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The Haeju boiled rice with assorted mixtures is a specialty to anyone visiting the area of South Hwanghae Province of Korea.
					 This is a typical food of Korea well known from olden times.
					
					 It is made of rice produced in this area and roots of broad bellflower, parsley, bracken and other edible herbs, seaweeds from the west coast, meats, etc.
					
					 Boiled rice is fried with oil and then mung-bean sprouts, bracken, parsley, roots of broad bellflower, bean sprouts, sliced fried egg and crumbed laver are put on it and mixed to serve customers.
					
					 This tasty and nutritious food is characterized by the mixture of bracken from Mt. Suyang and laver from the west coast.
					
					 Catering centers in South Hwanghae Province and Haeju City are working hard to improve the quality of the Haeju boiled rice with assorted mixtures, favorite food of inhabitants.

articles.title: Korean People Remember Writer Jo Ryong Chul
articles.content:
Korean People Remember Writer Jo Ryong Chul
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" hit a great sensation among the Korean and Chinese people.
					 Its libretto was written by writer Jo Ryong Chul (November 1913- May 1993), a winner of Kim Il Sung Prize.
					
					 In his lifetime Jo created many literary and art works and adapted and adorned national classics.
					
					 Among them are lyrics "Song of National Defence", "Off We Go, Brindled Ox", "The 2 000-ri Amnok River", "Song of Mangyongdae" and "If Our Mother Party Wishes" and libretto of Opera "Eight Fairies of Mt. Kumgang". 
					
					 He also made a special contribution to adapting masterpiece "The Fate of a Self-defence Corps Man" for an opera and creating folk opera "Tale of Chun Hyang".  
					
					 The books on his works include "Selection of Poems by Jo Ryong Chul" (1957) and "Collection of Plays by Jo Ryong Chul" (1961).
					
					 He is still remembered by the Korean people for having contributed to the development of the Juche-based literature and arts with his high ability.

articles.title: Gift "Jiu Long Xi Zhu"
articles.content:
Gift "Jiu Long Xi Zhu"
						
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- A tree root sculpture "Jiu Long Xi Zhu" was a gift the Fenghuang Investment Group Co. Ltd., Hong Kong, sent to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 During their visits to the DPRK, officials of the corporation admired him for his continued inspection of army units and field guidance over industrial establishments and agricultural farms.
					
					 They decided to present a gift to him on the occasion of his birthday, February 16, Juche 97 (2008).
					
					 The gift reflects their deep reverence for the DPRK leader.
					
					 It is a traditional custom of the Chinese people to express their sincerity with sculptures made of tree roots. The corporation's officials went to Yunnan Province, China and found out a golden camphor tree root believed to be more than 1 000 years old in a primeval forest.
					
					 The sculpture weighing 3.5 tons contains words of best wishes written with pure gold.

articles.title: Sense of Guilt-- Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Sense of Guilt--Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Former U.S. President George Walker Bush gave up his visit to Switzerland for "security reasons," said the Rodong Sinmun newspaper.
					 Bush was expected to visit Geneva and address an event to be organized by a Jewish group. 
					
					 He obviously wanted to take the opportunity to improve his public image, but Swiss people took a frigid attitude towards his upcoming visit, said the daily in a short commentary.
					
					 A human rights organization of Switzerland threatened to charge Bush, well known as "war president" and "torture president", with criminal offense. 
					
					 Sponsors of a protest scheduled to be held during the event called on the protesters to bring shoes with them, the daily noted. When visiting Iraq in 2008 in his capacity as U.S. president, Bush was pelted with a piece of shoes at a press conference. 
					
					 During his term of office, Bush produced many tragedies, including invasion and human rights violation, in other countries. 
					
					 "His giving up the Switzerland visit tokens sense of guilt," the daily added.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Best Way for Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Best Way for Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to improve the north-south relations in the interests of the Korean nation and reunify the country independently and peacefully on the basis of reconciliation and unity, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Tuesday.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung advanced the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo 30 odd years ago. Nothing is better than this way for reunification as it correctly reflects the specific conditions of Korea and fully conforms with the demand and interests of the whole nation.
					
					 This proposal calls for founding a Federal Republic through establishment of a unified national government on the condition that the north and the south tolerate each other's differing ideology and social system, a government under which they exercise regional autonomy.
					
					 The reunification by federal formula is based on the realistic logic that those with differing ideas can live together in one country and differing systems can exist in a unified state. To found a unified state through federal formula based on one nation, one state, two systems and two governments is the best way for putting an end to the tragedy of the nation's division and reunifying the country at an early date both in view of the urgent requirement of the nation and the specific conditions of the north-south relations.
					
					 The validity of the said proposal has been clearly proved in the practice for national reunification. Through the historic June 15 joint declaration the north and the south of Korea declared before the whole world that they recognize that the north side-proposed low-level federation and the south side-proposed confederation have something in common with each other and will reunify Korea in this direction.
					
					 The adoption of the June 15 joint declaration brought about an epochal turn in accomplishing the Koreans' cause of national reunification.

articles.title: Projected US-S. Korea War Drill Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Projected US-S. Korea War Drill Censured in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Over 10 civic and social organizations of south Korea held the 137th actions for independent reunification and peace in Seoul on Feb. 15.
					 They included the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Confederation of Trade Unions.
					
					 They, in a written protest, accuse the U.S. and the present "government" of planning to stage Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises from the end of February.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities claim that the projected maneuvers are annual and ordinary ones for defense in a bid to mislead public opinion, while the Defense Ministry says that the involvement of huge U.S. reinforcements in the maneuvers is necessary for the conquer of the north, it says.
					
					 It holds that the soon-to-be-held joint exercises are just war exercises against the north in view of the purpose, nature, scale and the equipment to be involved in them, demanding that the U.S. and authorities stop at once the war gamble on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The organisations handed the written protest to the U.S. embassy.

articles.title: Hyon In Thaek, "Untypical" Unification Minister-- Chinese Newspaper
articles.content:
Hyon In Thaek, "Untypical" Unification Minister-- Chinese Newspaper
 Beijing, February 22 (KCNA) -- The Chinese military newspaper Zhongguo Guofengbao on Jan. 4 carried an article titled "Hyon In Thaek, 'Untypical' Unification Minister of South Korea".
					 The article says:
					
					 The south Korean Ministry of Unification, in its working plan for the new year submitted to the president some time ago, announced that it would make preparations for "unification by absorption" from the year 2011.
					
					 According to a recent poll in south Korea, the Ministry of Unification takes the first place in "what should be removed" and the second place in "what has nothing to do". The result indicates that the ministry's policy towards the north and its performance have failed to receive public favor.
					
					 Hyon studied and obtained a doctorate in political science in the U.S. For this academic career, he is recognized as a pro-U.S. element admiring the U.S. "democratic politics" and "view of human rights".
					
					 The U.S. support played a big part in his taking office as minister.  
					
					 His stand concerning the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula is exactly the same with the U.S. position.
					
					 For the sake of its strategic interests, the U.S. does not want the improvement of relations between the north and the south of Korea, to say nothing of its reunification. Hence, the U.S., in response to the DPRK's offering for the improvement of bilateral ties, has taken a position that it will never discuss the issue unless the DPRK gives up nuclear arms first.
					
					 It is unrealistic to urge the DPRK to give up nuclear arms first in the settlement of the Korean peninsula's nuclear issue with a complicated historical background. If the U.S. insists on this position, the issue will be an impossible thing.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak's election platform -- "denuclearization, opening and 3 000" -- was suggested by Hyon, who was active as one of Lee's foreign policy advisers, following the U.S. policy.  
					
					 The "credit" for deteriorated relations between the north and the south goes to Hyon sharing the same position with the U.S.
					
					 The international community is of the opinion that the north and the south of the peninsula should achieve a peaceful reunification through sincere negotiations.
					
					 But Hyon is not interested in the way of reunifying the country through negotiations based on an equal footing. He asserts that the country should be unified through "collapse" of the DPRK government and its absorption and that, for this purpose, the Ministry of Unification should be "Ministry of Absorption". 
					
					 He, attached to the mode of the German reunification, has zealously spread the "theory on the DPRK's possible collapse", pinning his hope to "change" within the DPRK. He also insists that south Korea should take a positive step to promote the change and unify the country through "absorption".  
					
					 Many south Koreans are suspicious of the afore-mentioned plan, viewing it as unrealistic.

articles.title: Chinese Security Minister Calls for Strengthening Border Guard
articles.content:
Chinese Security Minister Calls for Strengthening Border Guard
 Beijing, February 22 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, minister of Public Security of China, called for building an impregnable fortress for defending the social stability in the border areas.
					 At a meeting of frontier guards on Feb. 10, he, who is also a state councilor, said the guards should be deeply aware of a new situation and challenge that the border guard is faced with, and display a high degree of responsibility, while consolidating mass foundations.
					
					 Commanding officers of all border garrisons should work out their plans as part of the Party and the state affairs, intensify training and boost the capabilities to cope with emergency, he said.
					
					 He also underscored the need for border garrisons to fully discharge their mission, keep themselves on high alert against multinational crimes and give full play to positive and creative manner of work.
					
					 Last year Chinese frontier guards dealt with 2,153 cases of drug smuggling, arrested 2,883 criminal suspects and seized 3,828.75 kilograms of drugs. They also confiscated 2,023 weapons of various kinds and more than 53,000 bullets.

articles.title: US Impedes DPRK-Japan Negotiations
articles.content:
US Impedes DPRK-Japan Negotiations
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- It has been revealed that the United States has tried backstage to block the resumption of DPRK-Japan negotiations.
					 According to the Japanese newspaper Mainichi Shimbun on Feb. 17, the minister of the U.S. embassy in Tokyo invited veteran dietmen concerned with diplomatic and security affairs from the Democratic Party, Liberal Democratic Party and New Komeito Party to his residence on the evening of Feb. 15 to find fault with Japan's position on DPRK-Japan relations.
					
					 As regards the Japanese foreign minister's remark about possible negotiations with the DPRK, the minister inquired into its real meaning, voicing his misgivings to the foreign minister, said the newspaper.
					
					 The fact shows that the U.S. does not hesitate to hurt even its ally's interests for the sake of its own interests in northeast Asia, including the Korean peninsula, and that it hampers the relaxation of tension in the region.

articles.title: Afghans Suffer from Drugs
articles.content:
Afghans Suffer from Drugs
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Many people in Afghanistan, known as a major drug producer, are suffering from drug addiction.
					 About a million people are addicted to drugs, 13 percent of them being children and 20 percent women. 
					
					 An estimated 50,000 people take heroin, 150,000 narcotine, and 500,000 hashish. Of the addicts, 180,000 use drugs as pain-killer.
					
					 The drug abuse has caused the prevalence of crimes, lowering of productivity and deterioration of health among Afghans.

articles.title: Violence against Women Gets Worse in US
articles.content:
Violence against Women Gets Worse in US
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Violence against women has become a serious problem in the United States.
					 The special rapporteur of the United Nations in charge of violence against women revealed the fact in a press conference on Feb. 7.
					
					 A survey found that violence against women in families and army was of various and extensive forms.
					
					 In particular, American aborigines, immigrants and African-Americans hold a majority of the victims. 
					
					 Statistical figures released by the U.S. Department of Justice indicate that one out of three aborigines suffers sexual abuses and three out of five physical violence.
					
					 Sixty to eighty percent of violence against aborigines is done by nonaborigines.
					
					 No proper legislation has existed in the country to protect aborigines.
					
					 The rapporteur urged the U.S. to take responsible measures for preventing violence.

articles.title: Wholesale Animal Deaths in US
articles.content:
Wholesale Animal Deaths in US
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Wholesale animal deaths have been reported in the United States from the beginning of the year, making the Americans uneasy.
					 Flocks of dead birds fell down on roofs and gardens of houses in Arkansas. 
					
					 Such phenomena were also witnessed in Louisiana, Pennsylvania and California.
					
					 Meanwhile, shoals of dead fishes have increased public doubt and worry.
					
					 Some 100,000 dead fishes were found in an Arkansas river and, a week later, two million dead fishes in the sea off Maryland.
					
					 Upset by the phenomena, local people feel suspicion that they are of bad omen.

articles.title: Auto Sale Grows in Russia
articles.content:
Auto Sale Grows in Russia
Moscow, February 22 (KCNA) -- Car sales have grown by 30 percent in Russia last year, according to a local newspaper.
					 Russians purchased a total of some 1,910,000 brand-new cars and minibuses last year, said Rossiskaya Gazeta.
					
					 Last year's best seller is a homemade car, Rada, with a record of 517,147 sales.
					
					 Nine of the ten most popular vehicles are local ones.
					
					 The homemade automobiles are not expensive and secondhand vehicles have been scrapped in the country in recent years. 
					
					 Increased buying power, low bank loan interest and the local currency getting stable also stimulated the rapid growth in the Russian auto market.
					
					 2,240,000 vehicles are expected to be sold this year. Exports are of the view that auto sales will reach 2.8-2.9 million next year, given the economic situation remaining stable, so that the auto market will be able to regain the pre-economic crisis level.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Nepalese, Indian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Nepalese, Indian Papers
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Nepal and India carried special write-ups with photos of General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the run-up to his birthday, February 16.
					 The Feb. 9 issue of the Nepalese paper Majodur in an article titled "Single-minded Unity of the DPRK" said that the Korean people become a harmonious whole with their leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					  It said that they repose absolute trust in him and entrust their destiny and future upon him.
					
					 The Nepalese paper Arpan in its Feb. 10 issue carried an article under the title of "Prominent Ideo-theoretical Activities", saying: 
					
					Kim Jong Il turned the Workers' Party of Korea into a glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and the DPRK into an invincible socialist power and trained the Korean people to be a people strong in idea and faith.
					
					 The Feb. 10 and 11 issues of the Indian papers Defence and Humanity and Tourism Era carried articles praising Kim Jong Il as a world elder statesman and a tender-hearted father of the people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Finnish Politician
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Finnish Politician
						
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Kalevi Wahrman, chairman of the Finnish Communists' League, expressed boundless reverence for General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 In an interview with KCNA, he said:
					
					 I warmly congratulate Kim Jong Il on his birthday and heartily wish him good health.
					
					 He, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, enjoys deep respect and high praise from all people for his immortal exploits for the times and history.
					
					 He has devoted his all to the accomplishment of the socialist cause.
					
					 He authored "Socialism Is a Science" and many other works to clarify the scientific accuracy and truth of socialism.
					
					 Those works serve as a militant banner dynamically propelling the socialist movement.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is the prominent leader steering the socialist cause to victory.
					
					 Thanks to the Songun politics the strength of the DPRK has been boosted and its external prestige remarkably raised.
					
					 The reality of the DPRK gives confidence and courage to us.
					
					 We extend full support to the Korean people in the efforts for the country's prosperity and national reunification.
					
					 We will as ever strive to develop the friendly relations between the two parties.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between Feb.10 and 12 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included a meeting, lecture, photo exhibition and film show in Romania, Guinea, Norway and India.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal revolutionary exploits and books and photos on Songun Korea. 
					
					 Korean films shown included "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation", "Party Founding Memorial Tower". 
					
					 The chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania said at a meeting that Kim Jong Il enjoys boundless respect and admiration from the world people for his great exploits for the Korean revolution and global independence.
					
					 The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea said in a lecture that every day spent by Kim Jong Il on the field guidance for the people's happiness and the country's prosperity serves as a main factor and source which encourages all the people to the great surge and leap forward to bring about world-startling events in the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway at a film show praised Kim Jong Il for having wisely led the Korean people in their struggle to defend socialism and build a thriving nation with his unique Songun politics despite the imperialist allied forces' moves to stifle the DPRK.

articles.title: Venezuelan Juche Idea Study Society Holds Meeting
articles.content:
Venezuelan Juche Idea Study Society Holds Meeting
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea reviewed its work for last year and discussed its working plan for this year. Its annual meeting was held on Feb. 11.
					 At the meeting its Chairman Omar Lopez underscored the need to conduct more active work for studying and disseminating the Juche idea and increase its adherents on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" was brought out in booklet by the Khabarovskaya Krayevaya Tipografia Publishing House in Russia on Feb. 14.
					 The work, published on Jan. 29, 2003, clarifies the idea that the Workers' Party of Korea's Songun revolutionary line, the Songun politics is a powerful political mode of the present era which inherited President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of giving priority to arms and a scientific revolutionary line, political mode which most correctly reflected the demand of the times and revolution. 
					
					 It also tells about the validity, advantages and great vitality of the Songun politics.

articles.title: Anecdote about Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Anecdote about Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- It was one day in October 1957 when President Kim Il Sung met students in Tongju-ri, Pyoktong County during his field guidance to North Phyongan Province of the country.
					 After talking with the students, the President told officials to take a souvenir photo before the sunset.
					
					 He sat on the grass and chose every position for the students to pose for a picture.
					
					 But the cameraman felt perplexed because there were too many students to collect all of them into one lens.
					
					 Understanding this situation, the President stood up to look for best photographic side with the camera. Then he told the cameraman to focus it on the second button of uniform worn by a student in the middle.
					
					 The photographer, however, hesitated to press the shutter because shot in that direction was hard to put the image of the President in the center of photo.
					
					 Reading his mind, the President repeatedly asked the cameraman to make sure that the photo has clear faces of the students.
					
					 After all, the photographer could not but press the shutter of camera focused on the student.
					
					 This benevolent image of Kim Il Sung among students living in a mountainous area is still kept deep in minds of the people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de TV Central de China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de TV Central de China
  Pyongyang, 22 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presente que le dedicara la TV Central de China.
					  El vicerredactor en jefe Huang Chuanfang, de visita en Corea, lo entrego el dia 21 a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: Entidad rusa decide otorgar orden a Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Entidad rusa decide otorgar orden a Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 22 de febrero (ATCC) -- La Federacion Internacional de las Entidades de Caridad de Rusia "Mundo de Buena Voluntad" decidio el dia 11 otorgar la orden "Corazon de pasion" al Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					La ceremonia de entrega tuvo lugar el dia 16 en la embajada coreana en Rusia.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el presidente O. V. Oleinik y otros funcionarios de la mencionada federacion, el embajador Kim Yong Jae y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica coreana.
					
					En el acto fueron trasladados al embajador coreano la orden y el certificado.

articles.title: Zhang Zhijun y su comitiva visitan Palacio Memorial Kumsusan
articles.content:
Zhang Zhijun y su comitiva visitan Palacio Memorial Kumsusan
Pyongyang, 22 de febrero (ATCC) -- El viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores de China, Zhang Zhijun, y su comitiva visitaron el dia 22 el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan y rindieron tributo al Presidente Kim Il Sung, quien hizo gran aporte al desarrollo de la amistad Corea-China y al cumplimiento de la causa de la independencia en el mundo.
					Zhang escribio en el libro de visitas que el Presidente Kim Il Sung estara vivo para siempre en el alma de los pueblos de China y Corea.

articles.title: Iniciada la obra de construccion de acueducto Nampho-Pyongyang
articles.content:
Iniciada la obra de construccion de acueducto Nampho-Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 22 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este martes la ceremonia de comienzo de la obra de construccion del acueducto Nampho-Pyongyang.
					Las aguas saladas transportadas por esta via posibilitaran el suministro suficiente de agua potable de buena calidad a los capitalinos. 
					
					En el acto estuvieron presentes los funcionarios interesados, los constructores y trabajadores capitalinos.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta la cancelacion de visita de Bush a Suiza
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta la cancelacion de visita de Bush a Suiza
Pyongyang, 22 de febrero (ATCC) -- En el reciente numero del diario Rodong Sinmun fue publicado el comentario breve de Jon Yong Hui titulado "Expresion de culpabilidad".
					  El ex presidente de Estados Unidos, Bush, cancelo de repente su programada visita a Suiza por el problema de "seguridad", comienza el comentario y continua:
					
					  Estaba previsto que Bush pronunciaria un discurso en un acto organizado en Ginebra por una entidad de judios.
					
					  El habria pensado que durante su viaje a Europa, podria destacar su presencia como ex mandatario de EE.UU.
					
					  Sin embargo, los suizos se mostraron indiferentes y hasta nerviosos al informarse de esa visita.
					
					  Una entidad suiza de derechos humanos amenazo con acusar al juicio penal a ese "presidente de guerras y torturas". De otro lado, la parte, que programo la manifestacion de protesta al paralelo de la participacion de Bush en el acto arriba mencionado, exhorto a sus seguidores a tomar parte con los zapatos no para ponerse sino para tirar.
					
					Esto habria recordado seguramente a Bush aquella pesadilla que ha pasado durante esa famosa entrevista de prensa concedida en 2008 durante su visita a Iraq. 
					
					Por sus multiples crimenes como violacion de DDHH e invasion armada contra Estados soberanos, Bush se vio obligado a desistir finalmente de su visita a Suiza.
					
					!Que miserable es el destino de el y su pais!
